metadata.description: This setting provides positive feedback before a download starts, limiting the possibility of inadvertent downloads without notifying the user.

criterion.comment: Check that the setting 'Ask where to save downloaded files' is enabled.

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000054 - Tracking of browsing activity must be disabled.
metadata.description:
The setting allows websites to be blocked from tracking users' web-browsing activity.
If this policy is disabled or is not configured, users can set their own level of tracking prevention.
Policy options mapping: - TrackingPreventionOff (0) = Off (no tracking prevention) - TrackingPreventionBasic (1) = Basic (blocks harmful trackers; content and ads will be personalized) - TrackingPreventionBalanced (2) = Balanced (blocks harmful trackers and trackers from sites user has not visited; content and ads will be less personalized) - TrackingPreventionStrict (3) = Strict (blocks harmful trackers and majority of trackers from all sites; content and ads will have minimal personalization; some parts of sites might not work)

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000055 - A website's ability to query for payment methods must be disabled.
metadata.description:
This setting determines whether websites can check if the user has payment methods saved.
If this policy is disabled, websites that use "PaymentRequest.canMakePayment" or "PaymentRequest.hasEnrolledInstrument" API will be informed that no payment methods are available.
If this policy is enabled or is not set, websites can check to determine if the user has payment methods saved.

criterion.comment: Check that the setting 'Allow websites to query for available payment methods' is disabled.

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000056 - Suggestions of similar web pages in the event of a navigation error must be disabled.
metadata.description:
This setting allows Microsoft Edge to issue a connection to a web service to generate URL and search suggestions for connectivity issues such as DNS errors.
If this policy is enabled, a web service is used to generate URL and search suggestions for network errors.
If this policy is disabled, no calls to the web service are made and a standard error page is shown.
If this policy is not configured, Microsoft Edge respects the user preference that is set under Services at edge://settings/privacy. Specifically, there is a "Suggest similar pages when a webpage can't be found" toggle, which the user can switch on or off.
Note that if this policy has been enabled (AlternateErrorPagesEnabled), the "Suggest similar pages when a webpage can't be found setting" is turned on, but the user cannot change the setting by using the toggle.
If this policy is disabled, the "Suggest similar pages when a webpage can't be found" setting is turned off, and the user cannot change the setting by using the toggle.

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000057 - User feedback must be disabled.
metadata.description:
Microsoft Edge uses the Edge Feedback feature (enabled by default) to allow users to send feedback, suggestions, or customer surveys and to report any issues with the browser. By default, users cannot disable (turn off) the Edge Feedback feature.
If this policy is enabled or not configured, users can invoke Edge Feedback.
If this policy is disabled, users cannot invoke Edge Feedback.

criterion.comment: Check that the setting 'Allow user feedback' is disabled.

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000058 - The collections feature must be disabled.
metadata.description:
This setting allows users to access the Collections feature, where they can collect, organize, share, and export content more efficiently and with Office integration.
If this policy is enabled or not configured, users can access and use the Collections feature in Microsoft Edge.
If this policy is disabled, users cannot access and use Collections in Microsoft Edge.

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000059 - The Share Experience feature must be disabled.
metadata.description:
If this policy is set to "ShareAllowed" (the default), users will be able to access the Windows 10 Share experience from the Settings and More menu in Microsoft Edge to share with other apps on the system.
If this policy is set to "ShareDisallowed", users will not be able to access the Windows 10 Share experience. If the Share button is on the toolbar, it will also be hidden.
Policy options mapping: - ShareAllowed (0) = Allow using the Share experience. - ShareDisallowed (1) = Do not allow using the Share experience.

criterion.comment: Check that the setting 'Configure the Share experience' is enabled with the option value set to 'Don't allow using the Share experience'.

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000060 - Guest mode must be disabled
metadata.description:
Enabling Guest mode allows the use of guest profiles in Microsoft Edge. In a guest profile, the browser does not import browsing data from existing profiles, and it deletes browsing data when all guest profiles are closed.
If this policy is enabled or not configured, Microsoft Edge lets users browse in guest profiles.
If this policy is disabled, Microsoft Edge does not let users browse in guest profiles.

criterion.comment: Registry check that BrowserGuestModeEnabled is set to 0 to disable Browser Guest Mode

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000061 - Relaunch notification must be required.
metadata.description: Users must be required to restart the browser to finish installation of pending updates and prevent users from continually using an old/vulnerable browser version.

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000062 - The built in DNS client must be disabled
metadata.description:
This setting controls whether to use the built-in DNS client.
This does not affect which DNS servers are used; it only controls the software stack that is used to communicate with them. For example, if the operating system is configured to use an enterprise DNS server, that same server would be used by the built-in DNS client. However, it is however possible that the built-in DNS client will address servers in different ways by using more modern DNS-related protocols such as DNS-over-TLS.
If this policy is enabled, the built-in DNS client is used if it is available.
If this policy is disabled, the client is never used.

criterion.comment: Built in DNS client is disabled

metadata.title: EDGE-00-000063 - Use of the QUIC protocol must be disabled
metadata.description:
QUIC is used by more than half of all connections from the Edge web browser to Google's servers, and this activity is undesirable in the DoD.
If you enable this policy or don't configure it, the QUIC protocol is allowed.
If you disable this policy, the QUIC protocol is blocked.

criterion.comment: QUIC protocol is disabled

win-def:registry_test.comment: Enable the setting 'Prevent bypassing Microsoft Defender SmartScreen prompts for sites'
Enable the setting 'Prevent bypassing Microsoft Defender SmartScreen warnings about downloads'
Enable the setting 'Continue running background apps after Microsoft Edge closes'

registry_test.comment: Do not allow any site to show pop-ups

win-def:registry_test.comment: Disable network prediction for MS Edge

registry_test.comment: Disable importing of autofill form data
Disable importing of autofill form data
Disable importing of home page settings
Disable importing of search engine settings

win-def:registry_test.comment: Check to make sure that Microsoft Edge is set to not allow deletion of browser history.
Edge Developer Tools Availability must be disallowed.
Enable the setting 'Control which extensions cannot be installed'

registry_test.comment: Minimum TLS version is enabled and set to TLS 1.2

win-def:registry_test.comment: Enable the setting 'Enable site isolation for every site'

registry_test.comment: Microsoft Defender SmartScreen must be enabled.
Microsoft Defender SmartScreen must be configured to block potentially unwanted apps.
Tracking of browsing activity must be disabled.

win-def:registry_test.comment: Disable the setting 'Allow websites to query for available payment methods'

registry_test.comment: Suggestions of similar web pages in the event of a navigation error must be disabled.
The collections feature must be disabled.

win-def:registry_test.comment: Enable the setting 'Enable site isolation for every site'

registry_test.comment: Built in DNS client is disabled

win-def:registry_object.comment: Check the registry value stored at HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\NetworkPredictionOptions
win-def:registry_object.win-def:name: NetworkPredictionOptions

win-def:registry_object.comment: Edge Allow Deletion of browser history gpo setting reg entry.
win-def:registry_object.win-def:name: AllowDeletingBrowserHistory

registry_state.comment: Reg_SZ type and value equals tls1.2

metadata.title: Microsoft Edge is Installed
metadata.description: Microsoft Edge is Installed.

criterion.comment: 64-bit Microsoft Edge is installed
32-bit Microsoft Edge is installed
